page.title: 08COUNTRY PARKS-DOWNSBANKS(2)
page.content: The Downs Banks consists of 160 acres originally purchased by John Joule & Sons brewers of Stone.They were endowed by public subscription and presented to the National Trust on July 22nd 1950 as a thanks offering for victory and as a memorial to those who fell in the second world war. The nature of the Downs Banks is determined by the free draining,acid,sandy soil of the hills and valley sides and the ill drained clay of the valley soil. The decidous woodland was planted prior to 1840.Pine and spruce have been planted by the National Trust. A trackway crosses the Downs and is traditionally regarded as part of the ancient pack horse route from Chester to the East Midlands.
